intro: Rauvolfia tiaolushanensis, commonly known as Tiaolushan everlasting, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to China, specifically found in the Tiaolushan region of Yunnan Province. The plant is characterized by its erect herbaceous stems and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a velvety texture. Rauvolfia tiaolushanensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential medicinal properties.
